greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Numerator of b(n) given by b(1) = 1, b(2) = 2; for n >= 3, b(n) = (-1)^n (2n-1) ((n-2)!!)^2/((n-1)!!)^2, where n!! is the double factorial A006882.
comment: b(n) is such that the continued fraction [b(1); b(2), b(3),..., b(n)] is equal to sum{k=1 to n} 1/k = H(n) = the n-th harmonic number, for all positive integers n.
a(2n)/A095175(2n) -> pi as n -> inf.; a(2n+1)/A095175(2n+1) -> -4/pi as n -> inf. - _Leroy Quet_, Aug 03 2004
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, based on a suggestion of _Leroy Quet_, Jul 03 2004
